summary: A statement from an individual describing a brutal attack in 1908 and subsequent living arrangements with their daughter, who was in a relationship with a man named Jeffrey Epstein. The document appears to be a personal account submitted to J.P. Morgan, though the relevance to the Epstein case is unclear from this excerpt.

persons.name: The Honourable
persons.context: The author of the statement, who describes being attacked in 1908 and later staying with their daughter.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: A gentleman who moved into the author's daughter's property and appeared to be in a relationship with her.

connections.description: Epstein was in a relationship with the author's daughter and lived in her property.

events.title: Brutal attack on author
events.description: The author was brutally attacked in their home by a man with an axe, beaten, held hostage, and their home was smashed. They eventually escaped and were taken to hospital.

events.title: Statement submission
events.description: The author submits a statement to J.P. Morgan, introducing themselves and providing an account of past events.

keyFacts: The document is a statement from an individual to J.P. Morgan dated August 2023.
The author describes a violent attack in June 1908 where they were beaten, held hostage, and their home was destroyed.
After the attack, the author stayed with their daughter, who was living with Jeffrey Epstein.
The author perceived Epstein and their daughter as a couple engaging in normal activities together.
The statement claims to be true, accurate, and not coerced, though its relevance to the Epstein case is not explicitly stated in this excerpt.
